languageKey.label: This field is used to define the template name, it will be visible in template list, inside the backend field template. It's very important to use a unique name for template.
In this field you can choose what groups can access this template. If you leave empty, all backend groups can access this template.
In this field you can insert a description to explain how does template work. This text is visible in template list of XFlexTemplate module, not in the template page item.

In this field you can insert the typoscript to use in your template.
Each template Element can be setted in this field, you can define back-end localized label for each fields too.
Example: Suppose you have just created an element named title and you want define the english label block title and italian translation as Titolo del template you have to write:
language.title.beLabel.en = block title
language.title.beLabel.it = Titolo del template

In this field you can insert the HTML code to use in your template.
Each field defines in the next section could be a placeholder to insert it into HTML code.
Each placeholder is constituited by three # follwed by name of element in upper case and then three #.
This field contains code of field in TCE Forms. This field have to be alphanumeric, without space and it mustn't a name of tt_content table.

This select contains the config type data of the TCE Form field.
If you change this value also the fields below change.

input: this is the standard input field
Text: this is the standard textarea field, you can use RTE leaving empty the defaultExtras. If you write anything in the defaultExtras field, RTE will not be shown.

This field defines the field in which these one will be shown. Palettes is the secondary fields and these type of fields are visible is you checked show secondary options (for a better understanding of palettes see API Core documentations of TYPO3).

Render Type is the default method to show this element. Each field will be rendered by tslib_content method, so this field will be rendered with IMAGE or TEXT or MULTIMEDIA (the render type you have choosen) unless you have changed the type by typoscript template form.
Maximum number of characters the user will be able to insert into the field.
The size attribute of the input element (the length of input box in characters).
Default value for the input box, if it's empty the value will be this.
Separated comma values of allowed words to be inserted in this input box.

Configuration of field evaluation.
The eval-functions will be executed in the list-order.
The possible values are:
required, trim, date, datetime, time, timesec, year, int, upper, lower, alpha, num, alphanum, alphanum_x, nospace, md5, is_in, password, double2, unique, uniqueInPid.
For a specific description of each value and how does it work, you can see TYPO3 Core API.
If defined (even empty), a checkbox is placed before the input field. If a value other than the value of 'checkbox' (this value) appears in the input-field the checkbox is checked.
The max value indicates the upper limit range. If value written by user is upper than limit, typo3 override value with upper limit.
The min value indicates the lower limit range. If value written by user is lower than limit, typo3 override value with lower limit.
The number of columns of textarea.
The number of rows of textarea.
Default value for the textarea, if it's empty the value will be this.
Determines the wrapping of the textarea field (for a better understanding of this field see API Core documentations of TYPO3).
This field contains the defaultExtras field defined in TYPO3 Core API. For textarea the default value contains is: richtext[]:rte_transform[flag=rte_enabled|mode=ts].

This field contains the elements of check box, each line is splitted by return and each line is divided in label,field by comma (Example: suppose to create two radio buttons, one with label check1 and value 1 and the second one with label check2 and value 2. You will write: check1,1[Enter]check2,2)
The number of columns the checkbox array are shown in
Default value for the checkbox, this value is binary and each bit corrisponds to one checkbox, so if you have 2 checkbox, 1 only firstone is checked, 3 both chewckboxes will be checked.
PHP function which is called to fill / manipulate the array with elements(for a better understanding of this field see API Core documentations of TYPO3).

This field contains the elements of radio box, each line is splitted by return and each line is divided in label,field by comma (Example: suppose to create two radio buttons, one with label radio1 and value 1 and the second one with label radio2 and value 2. You will write: radio1,1[Enter]radio2,2)
Default value for the radio, the specified radio will be selected.
PHP function which is called to fill / manipulate the array with elements(for a better understanding of this field see API Core documentations of TYPO3).
This field specifies where data will be fetched. If you choose file, the data will be a file in the filesystem, otherwise if you choose database, data will be one or more row from TCA tables.
This field contains a comma separated values of file extension (if you have choosen file from type of element) or TCA table list (if you have choose database from type of element) allowed.
This field contains a comma separated values of file extension (if you have choosen file from type of element) or TCA table list (if you have choose database from type of element) not allowed.
